instruction: The policy is emailed to the customer immediately upon purchasing. They can also view the policy in the Faye app. If this is mentioned to them and they say they have not received this, escalate.
input: Hi, I'm from NV. I paid for a policy and got a confirmation message on the website, but I never got the policy in the app or by email. What do I do?
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know. Since the policy is emailed immediately after purchase and should also appear in the app, and you haven‚Äôt received it in either place, I‚Äôll escalate this right away so the team can look into it for you.
agent_answer: You can also view it in the Faye app. If you have not received the policy email after checking the app, please let me know.

instruction:
When customers reach out asking Faye's contact information.

Customers can always chat with us in the Faye app, email us at support@withfaye.com or call us at 1-833-240-7056 (US/Canada). From all other locations, call us at 1-804-482-2122. We're available 24/7.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. Can you give me Faye‚Äôs contact information?
expected_answer: Of course! You can always chat with us directly in the Faye app, email us at support@withfaye.com, or call us at 1-833-240-7056 from the US or Canada. If you're traveling internationally, you can reach us at 1-804-482-2122. We're available 24/7 and here to help.
agent_answer:
I'd be happy to help you get in touch with our team! Here are the ways to reach our customer support team:

**Chat with us in the Faye app**

**Email:** support@withfaye.com

**Phone (US/Canada):** +1 833-240-7056

**Phone (all other locations):** +1 804-482-2122

We're available 24/7, so feel free to reach out whenever works best for you.

I can also transfer you to a live agent right now if you'd like to speak with someone directly. Would you like me to do that?

instruction: Customers experiencing a medical situation while traveling may visit any doctor or medical facility of their choice. There is no requirement to use in-network or affiliated providers; all licensed medical professionals and facilities are acceptable.
input: Hi, I'm from MT. If I will feel sick while traveling, do I need to go to a specific clinic that works with you, or can I see any doctor?
expected_answer: If you ever feel sick while traveling, you can visit any doctor or medical facility of your choice. There‚Äôs no requirement to use an in-network or affiliated provider ‚Äî any licensed medical professional or facility is perfectly acceptable.
agent_answer:
Great question! I'm glad you asked for clarity on this. Here's the good news: if you experience a medical situation while traveling, you have complete flexibility in choosing where to receive care.

You can visit **any doctor or medical facility of your choice** ‚Äî there's no requirement to use in-network or affiliated providers. All licensed medical professionals and facilities are acceptable, so you can feel confident seeking care wherever is most convenient for you during your travels.

Safe travels, and I hope you stay healthy out there! üòä

instruction: If someone would like to print the policy, they can do so from the PDF that is emailed immediately after purchase.
input: Hi, I'm from OR. I want to print my policy ‚Äî how can I do that?
expected_answer: You can print your policy from the PDF that‚Äôs emailed to you immediately after purchase. Just open the PDF from your email and print it whenever you need.
agent_answer: Great question! You can print your policy from the PDF that's emailed to you right away after your purchase. Just check your inbox (and spam folder, just in case!) for that email, and you'll be all set to print it whenever you need it. üìã

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) check if the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi Im from AL there is a bug in the website I get a 404. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for letting me know about the issue. First, what browser you're using to access the website?
agent_answer: Which browser are you using to access the website when you encounter the 404 error?

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi im from georgia there is a bug in the website I get a 404 on my chrome. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for the details and for confirming you‚Äôre using Chrome. Next, can you please check that you have a strong and stable Wi-Fi connection, and then try again?
agent_answer: Is your WiFi connection working properly? I want to confirm whether this 404 error is related to your internet connection or if it's a website issue.

instruction: When a user reports a 'something went wrong' error with a quote or bug, follow these steps: 1) Confirm the user is using the Google Chrome browser. 2) Ensure the user has a strong Wi-Fi connection. 3) If the issue persists after these checks, escalate the case to a support agent.
input: Hi im from georgia there is a bug in the website I get a 404 on my chrome and my wifi works great on other sites. can you fix it?
expected_answer: Thanks for confirming you‚Äôre using Chrome and that your Wi-Fi connection is working well. Since the issue is still happening after those checks, I‚Äôll escalate this case to a support agent so they can investigate and help resolve it.
agent_answer:
Thanks so much for providing those details, and I really appreciate you troubleshooting with me! I can see you've already confirmed that Chrome is working well and your Wi-Fi connection is strong on other sites‚Äîthat's super helpful information.

Since you're still experiencing the 404 error on our site even after ruling out those common culprits, this sounds like something that needs a closer look from our technical team. I'm going to escalate your request to one of our human agents who can dive deeper into what might be causing this issue and get it resolved for you.

A team member will be reaching out to you shortly to help get this sorted out. Thanks for your patience, and I'm sorry you've hit this snag! üôå

instruction: When customers inquire about partnerships or product integrations, direct them to the partnership business development team by providing the email address partnerships@withfaye.com. Inform them that the team will respond if the inquiry is relevant.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. I run a travel booking platform and I‚Äôd like to explore integrating Faye into our product. Who should I talk to?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out and for your interest in partnering with Faye. For partnership and product integration inquiries, please contact our partnership business development team at partnerships@withfaye.com. They review all inquiries and will get back to you if it‚Äôs relevant.
agent_answer: That sounds like an exciting opportunity! For partnership or product integration inquiries like yours, please contact our partnership business development team at partnerships@withfaye.com. The team will respond if your inquiry is relevant.

instruction: If they want to see the policy (a copy of the policy/a sample policy/the full policy or some such wording) they can be directed to https://www.withfaye.com/coverage/ and scroll down to the bottom of the page to find all of our policies linked.
input: Hi, I'm from VA. Before I buy, can I see a sample policy or the full policy document?
expected_answer: Absolutely! You can view the policy by visiting https://www.withfaye.com/coverage/ and scrolling to the bottom of the page, where all of our policies are linked.
agent_answer: Great question! You can view all of our policies by visiting https://www.withfaye.com/coverage/ and scrolling down to the bottom of the page, where you'll find all of our policies linked. This should give you a complete look at what we offer for Virginia before you make your decision. üòä

instruction: Payments can be done on the website using any credit card, Paypal, or Apple Wallet/Google Pay. We cannot split up the payment to multiple payments/cards.
input: Hi, I'm from SC. I want to buy a policy but I‚Äôd like to split the payment between two different credit cards. Can you do that?
expected_answer: Thanks for checking! Payments can be made on our website using any credit card, PayPal, or Apple Wallet/Google Pay. However, we aren‚Äôt able to split a single purchase across multiple payments or cards.
agent_answer:
Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to help you get set up with a policy.

When it comes to payment, we offer several convenient options on our website‚Äîyou can pay using any credit card, PayPal, or Apple Wallet/Google Pay. However, I do want to let you know that we're unable to split payments across multiple cards or divide a single payment into several transactions. You'll need to complete your payment using just one of these payment methods.

If you have any other questions about the payment process, I'm here to help! üòä

instruction: If a customer asks about an existing policy or receipt, escalate the inquiry immediately without asking any follow-up questions.
input: Hi I'm from UT, I have policy number 43198791 and I think I got charged more than I should. Please tell me what went wrong.
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Since this involves an existing policy and billing, I‚Äôll escalate your inquiry right away so the appropriate team can review it for you.
agent_answer:
Thanks for reaching out, and I appreciate you providing your policy number. I can see that you're an existing policyholder with us, and I want to make sure you get the best possible help with your billing concern.

Since you've identified a potential issue with your charges, I'll need to escalate your request to one of our human agents who can review your account details and policy in depth. They'll have the full access needed to look into what happened and make sure everything is accurate.

A specialist will be reaching out to you shortly to investigate this. In the meantime, if there's anything else I can help clarify, I'm here for you! üòä

instruction: Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip, including while items are checked with a common carrier. The coverage may also include reimbursement for passport, visa, or credit card replacement, and baggage delay purchases if baggage is delayed for 12+ hours.
input: Hi, I'm from NC. Can you explain what the Baggage and Personal Effects coverage includes?
expected_answer: Sure! Baggage and Personal Effects coverage provides reimbursement for personal items that are lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip ‚Äî including when they‚Äôre checked with a common carrier. It may also cover reimbursement for replacing a passport, visa, or credit card, as well as purchases made if your baggage is delayed for 12 hours or more.
agent_answer:
I'd be happy to explain what Baggage and Personal Effects coverage includes! 

This coverage provides reimbursement for personal items that are lost, stolen, damaged, or destroyed during a covered trip ‚Äî including items you have checked with a common carrier like an airline.

Beyond that, the coverage can also help with a few other situations:

‚Ä¢ **Passport, visa, or credit card replacement** ‚Äî if these documents need to be replaced during your trip
‚Ä¢ **Baggage delay purchases** ‚Äî if your baggage is delayed for 12 or more hours, you may be reimbursed for necessary purchases while you wait

It's a nice safety net to have in place for those unexpected travel hiccups! Is there anything specific about this coverage you'd like me to clarify further?

instruction: When answering questions about the government shutdown, clearly state that the policy does not cover incidents related to the shutdown if the event was known at the time of purchase. For policies purchased after October 1, incidents related to the government shutdown are not covered, as the shutdown became a known event on October 1.
input: Hi, I'm from CO. I'm worried the government shutdown might delay my trip. If I buy a policy now, will I be covered for issues caused by the shutdown?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. The government shutdown became a known event on October 1, so any policies purchased after that date do not provide coverage for incidents related to the shutdown. Because it‚Äôs already a known event, issues caused by it would not be covered.
agent_answer:
I completely understand your concern‚Äîtravel disruptions are stressful, and it's smart to think ahead about your coverage. Let me clarify how this works for you.

Here's the key point: **all policy coverages apply to unknown events.** However, since the government shutdown became a known event on October 1st, policies purchased after that date may not be covered for incidents directly related to the government shutdown.

Since you're looking to purchase a policy now, this means any shutdown-related issues that occur after your purchase date would likely fall outside your coverage.

That said, every policy is unique, and I'd love to help you understand exactly how this affects your specific situation and trip. **If you have further questions about how this applies to your policy, I'm happy to help clarify.** Feel free to share more details about your trip or policy, and we can walk through this together!

instruction: You cannot extend your coverage once your trip has started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased prior to your trip, up until departure. Additionally, you cannot purchase a second plan on trip once the first plan ends to extend coverage, all policies must be purchased prior to the start of the trip.
input: Hi, I'm from CA. My trip already started but I want to extend my coverage by a few more days. Can you extend my current plan?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out. Coverage cannot be extended once your trip has already started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased before your trip begins, up until departure.
agent_answer:
I appreciate you reaching out, and I completely understand wanting to extend your coverage while traveling‚Äîit's a practical thought! However, I have to share some important information about how Faye travel insurance works.

Unfortunately, once your trip has started, we're not able to extend your existing coverage. Here's what you need to know:

- **Faye travel insurance must be purchased before your trip starts**, up until your departure date
- You also **cannot purchase a second plan** once your current plan ends to extend coverage
- **All policies need to be purchased prior to the start of your trip**

I know this might not be the answer you were hoping for, but this policy is in place for all travelers. If you have any other questions about your current coverage or need further assistance, I'm here to help! Is there anything else I can support you with today?

instruction: You cannot extend your coverage once your trip has started. Faye travel insurance must be purchased prior to your trip, up until departure. Additionally, you cannot purchase a second plan on trip once the first plan ends to extend coverage, all policies must be purchased prior to the start of the trip.
input: Hi, I'm from NV. My policy ends tomorrow but I‚Äôm still traveling. Can I buy another plan right now to keep myself covered for a few more days?
expected_answer: Thanks for checking in. You can‚Äôt purchase a second plan to extend coverage once your trip has already begun. All policies must be purchased before the start of your trip, so we‚Äôre unable to extend or restart coverage mid-trip.
agent_answer:
I understand you're looking to extend your coverage while you're still traveling ‚Äì that's definitely a stressful situation! Unfortunately, I have some important information to share about how Faye travel insurance works.

You're not able to purchase a second plan once your current policy ends to extend your coverage. Additionally, you cannot extend your coverage once your trip has started. All Faye travel insurance policies must be purchased prior to the start of your trip, up until departure.

I know this might not be the answer you were hoping for, but I wanted to be upfront with you about our policy requirements. If you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can help you with regarding your current coverage, please let me know ‚Äì I'm here to help! üíô

instruction: If you have CFAR, you can only increase the trip cost if you do so within 14 days of purchasing the travel arrangement that you are adding the cost of (or 15 days if you live in AZ, NC, NJ, WI).
input: Hi, I'm from NJ. I bought my flights three weeks ago and I have CFAR. Can I increase my trip cost to include a new hotel I booked?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Since you live in NJ, you can increase your trip cost within 15 days of purchasing the travel arrangement you're adding. Because your flights were purchased three weeks ago, you‚Äôre outside that window, so you wouldn‚Äôt be able to increase your trip cost at this point.
agent_answer:
Thanks for reaching out! I appreciate you sharing those details with me.

Since you live in New Jersey, you're able to increase your trip cost within 15 days of purchasing the travel arrangement you're adding. I can see that your travel arrangement was purchased 21 days ago, which means you're just outside that window, so unfortunately you wouldn't be able to increase your trip cost at this point.

I know this might not be the answer you were hoping for, but I'm here if you have any other questions or if there's anything else I can help you with!

instruction: Rental car insurance is not available for residents of Hawaii. When available, rental car coverage must be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. If added, it protects a rental vehicle for the duration of the trip by reimbursing the traveler for: physical damage to the rental car due to collision, vandalism, theft, natural disaster, or events beyond the traveler‚Äôs control; theft of the vehicle (if unrecovered); loss-of-use charges or administrative fees charged by the rental agency.
input: Hi, I'm from HI and I'm renting a car in Japan. How much does rental car insurance cost if I add it?
expected_answer: Thanks for reaching out! Rental car insurance is not available for residents of Hawaii, so it can‚Äôt be added to your policy.
agent_answer: I appreciate you reaching out! I want to let you know that rental car insurance isn't available for residents of Hawaii. I understand this might be disappointing, especially while you're planning your trip to Japan. If you have any questions about alternative coverage options or need help with anything else regarding your rental, I'm here to assist you.

instruction: When available, rental car coverage must be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. If added, it protects a rental vehicle for the duration of the trip by reimbursing the traveler for: physical damage to the rental car due to collision, vandalism, theft, natural disaster, or events beyond the traveler‚Äôs control; theft of the vehicle (if unrecovered); loss-of-use charges or administrative fees charged by the rental agency.
input: Hi, I'm from CA and I'm renting a car in Italy. Can you explain what your rental car coverage includes?
expected_answer: Sure! Rental car coverage can be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. It reimburses you for physical damage to the rental vehicle caused by collision, vandalism, theft, natural disasters, or events outside your control. It also covers theft of the vehicle if it isn‚Äôt recovered, as well as loss-of-use charges or administrative fees from the rental agency.
agent_answer:
Great question! I'm happy to walk you through our rental car coverage for your trip to Italy.

When available, rental car coverage must be added as an optional benefit during plan selection. If you add it to your plan, here's what you'll get protected for while renting that car:

- **Physical damage to the rental car** due to collision, vandalism, theft, natural disaster, or events beyond your control
- **Theft of the vehicle** (if it's not recovered)
- **Loss-of-use charges or administrative fees** that the rental agency charges you

So essentially, if something happens to your rental during your trip, this coverage helps reimburse you for those costs. üõ°Ô∏è

Since you're heading to Italy, I'd definitely recommend adding this optional benefit when you're selecting your plan ‚Äì it'll give you extra peace of mind while you're traveling!

Do you have any other questions about what's covered?
